Reviews.Title: Extensive Review By Photography Newbie
Reviews.Author: Alan Montgomery
Reviews.Content: This review is aimed at people who are new to photography, as I am in the same boat.  There are much more thorough reviews on Amazon for people who are already serious photographers.General Impression:Wonderful camera - gives you control of parameters (such as f/stop, ISO, shutter speed) when you want to play with them or get creative and will auto-select them when you just want to take pictures.  This was important to me as I am still learning to adjust them to my liking but don't want to miss out on pictures because I'm fumbling around with buttons.Construction/Feel:After going to Best Buy to physically hold the Canon T3i and Nikon d5100, I immediately decided on the Nikon.  It felt much better in my hands and just looked better in general.  Both were fairly light which is nice but also means they are made from quite a bit of plastic - not a problem though as this keeps the price down and I don't drop things.Controls:I have been pleased with the placement of the physical buttons on the camera as well as the menus.  I mainly shoot in the A, S, and M modes and the little wheel you turn to adjust the shutter speed/aperture is right where your thumb falls.  If you're in M mode, there is an aperture button to hold down just behind the shutter button which is also easy to reach with the camera up to your eye.  Lastly, the Fn button can be programmed to control the ISO level so you can hold it down while spinning the wheel to change that without putting the camera down.  I have heard people complain that the Live View switch is annoying to get to but have found it intuitive.There are a few controls that I wish were changeable without having to dig through a menu though.  For instance, to change the focus mode from area to single point requires you to have the LCD screen turned around, then press the I button, then scroll around to change it.  This is the case for a few other things like metering, shutter mode, etc.  I can't really complain, though, because those are features that go on a serious photographer's camera that costs about twice as much as this model.Auto Focus:The 11-point AF on this camera has been a dream to use.  I almost always keep the camera set to single point servo autofocus so I can select the point I want it to focus to.  As long as you have some contrast, it is very quick and accurate to focus.  This camera does not have a build in focus motor which means the lens must have it built in.  As a result, older lenses or those build for the professional Nikons may not allow for autofocus.  This hasn't been a big issues as most of the lenses I would want already have the motor built in, and if they don't, people survived for a long time manually focusing - it probably builds character.  I was torn between getting the Nikon 10-24mm f/3.5-4.5G ED AF-S DX Nikkor Wide-Angle Zoom Lens for Nikon Digital SLR Camerasand Tokina AT-X116PRDXN AT-X PRO DX 11-16mm Ultra-wide Angle Lens for Nikonand ended up sticking with the Tokina even though it would not autofocus on this camera.  I haven't had any issues with focusing manually with it as the ultra-wide angles are easy to focus anyway.Noise:A lot of the reviews I read before purchasing this camera talked about how well it shot in low light - I would have to agree.  Looking at pictures from my old point and shoot at ISO 800 have horrible noise while I can shoot this at 1600 without any, and can go up to 3200 with only minimal touch ups in Lightroom needed.  This has to be the single biggest advantage of digital over film - being able to change ISO on the fly and still being able to get great pictures at ISO 3200 is wonderful.Image Quality:I won't offer too many opinions in this section, but I have not seen anything but great quality in the RAW pictures I've taken.  Basically I understand that if a picture doesn't come out right, the fault lies with me and not the camera.  The camera is capable of much better pictures than I am capable of taking.  When I do everything right (which is becoming a little more frequent) I am amazed of the result.  Great colors, great contrast, low noise, etc.Battery Life:I purchased an extra battery before I went on a few business trips just in case, but ended up never being close to needing it.  The battery just lasts and lasts and never seems to drain.  For instance, last weekend I took 381 shots (some using live view) and the battery meter was still at 75%.  No complaints in this department.Flash:The built in flash is pretty puny, which seems to be par for the course.  It does provide some nice fill lighting if you're outside taking pictures where there are some shadows on your subject, but for shooting inside it's marginal at best.  I bought the very reasonably priced Nikon SB-400 AF Speedlight Flash for Nikon Digital SLR Cameras and have been very pleased with the combo.  The external flash adds the ability to bounce light off the ceiling and not waste the camera battery while doing so. This camera does not have the Nikon flash commander ability, but I don't think that should be expected in a camera at this price point.  If I ever start buying 3 remote flashes for studio shooting, there is a good chance I will have already upgraded cameras.I'll end by saying that this has been an absolutely wonderful camera to learn to shoot on.  Before I purchased it or started shooting, I ordered and read two books,Complete Digital Photography, 6th EditionThe Digital Photography Book, Volume 1 so I would have some clue what I wanted in a camera.  They are both wonderful books and should be required reading for all new photographers.As a disclaimer: up till 3 months ago I was never in to photography, never owned an SLR and never had any real interest to.  So know that everything I say in this review is based on very little experience.

Reviews.Title: What a great deal!!!
Reviews.Author: stargaze
Reviews.Content: I checked prices all over and this was absolutely the best deal. This camera is amazing. Everytime I use it I learn something new about it. I love the 300mm lense and the macro is so very cool. The video is amazing quality and so easy to use. I am having a blast with this camera. I am not a professional. I had an old Nikon E4040 35mm that I loved. Then I got a simple digital point and shoot. Now I have this amazing camera. I have lots to learn still but already it was money well spent. Oh be careful with the tripod, it is not heavy duty. I did buy a higher end tripod to better safe guard my camera. The batteries do last a long time and it is great having two. The battery drains faster when shooting video as expected. The size of the SD card is wonderful. My old Nikon lenses did fit the camera and work but the quality is not the same as the new lenses. I love shoping with Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Awesome package!
Reviews.Author: RPZ
Reviews.Content: Comes With:Nikon D5100 CameraNikkor Zoom Lense - 18-55mm (Vibration Reduction & Auto Focus)Sigma Zoom Lense - 70-300mm (Vibration Reduction & Auto Focus)Battery - in addition to the one it comes with59" lightweight tripod w/ caseHDMI Cable - to hook up camera to TV16gig Memory CardMemory Card Reader - USBMemory Card Wallet (roughly 1.5"x2")Screen Protectors (3)Cleaning KitCamera Case - w/ 2 side and 1 front pocketDVD Camera TipsI was a little sceptical about the sigma lens, but it shoots like a dream.  The only problem is, I can't find lens filters that fit both lens as sigma is larger than the Nikkor.  The Camera Case is perfect for storage and "safe environment" use.  I would recommend looking into a "Camera Backpack" if you want to go to sporting events, hiking, beach or crowded areas.  I would also suggest "Nikon D5100 For Dummies" as this book covers everything you need/wish to know.In my opinion, it beats all other cameras in the "under $1000" price range, then on top of it you get all the other goodies!

Reviews.Title: Loving the D5100 Nikon
Reviews.Author: Mitch DeCanter
Reviews.Content: As a professional award wining artistic and creative photographer, I have use Nikon products for more than 25 years and have always trusted the Nikon. I have used a Fuji S3 for about 8 years, which is built on the Nikon Body for professional work, I suspect that I have shot more that 500,000 images during that time and the camera still does a fine job, howbeit when it started showing signs of shutter and mirror drag, I started research for a new replacement camera,  Now being retired I wanted something that gave me ease of use, but also the bells and whistles to do artistic and creative nature photography with dependability and quality image files.  A friend obtained the Nikon 3100, so by reviewing his camera, and testing lens and such, the Nikon D5100 met the requirements and at a price fitting my budget.  The bundle seems to be the best deal, but I did not have use of some if the items, which made a good gift to a want to be photographer.  Overall, I am 100% pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good, Good, Good.
Reviews.Author: Nelson Ronal Melendez Pinzon
Reviews.Content: Good service, Good deal, Good product.The camera is beautiful, weighs very little, but is very ergonomic.The lenses are very good, work well.The only downside is the battery life. It downloads very fast when the LCD is on. For long sessions have to close the screen.Using the remote control and swivel screen are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: A ++++ The DSLR CAM
Reviews.Author: W4RCHILD "Sebastian"
Reviews.Content: Is my first SLR cam, what can I say?This bundle kit is a good way to start.The camera is amazing, has many features for professional photography.The lenses are perfect to a starter user.The pack is complete. In addition I bought faster SD cards and a extra batteries and Lowe Pro back pack (which I recommend for this cam)Hope you can enjot it as I'm doing right now!

Reviews.Title: Great Nikon 5100 Package
Reviews.Author: DAL
Reviews.Content: This Nikon 5100 Package includes everything that I need to get back into my photographic hobby.  I have been away from photography for about 30 years so I wanted something better than the basic "point and shoot" camera but not as expensive as a high-end DSLR.  This package completely satisfies my current requirements.

Reviews.Title: All the perfect accesories for a beginner...
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: This kit has made me up with the stuff a photographer needs to make its hobbie (as it is a hobbie for me) easier. The memory card adapter is great 'cause it supports 4 kinds of memory cards. And as I was trying to decide which was the best between D5100 and D3200, I now see I did a really good decision. Even when the D3200 has more MP (there's also a kit available here in Amazon), the D5100 has better sensitivity and I'm the kind of person who likes to take pictures at night.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Rodgers
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent camera. A perfect DSLR for a beginner or a advanced photographer. Has too many features to name here. Plus I shopped around before making this purchase a this bundle was the best deal I came across by far.

Reviews.Title: 5 Star Camera - 4 Star Kit
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bottom Tooth
Reviews.Content: So far the camera itself has been great. The kit itself is pretty decent. The camera bag I received was okay but felt pretty flimsy and cheap compared to my Samsonite DSLR bag. The biggest problem was with the included memory card. My card was a Sony branded one, which according to Nikon's page for the D5100, is not on the tested and approved list. Of course I didn't think to check the card make before some shooting and that turned out to be a problem.I placed the card into the included USB reader and all the pictures showed up. When I went to move them over to the computer, it failed. Then neither the PC or the camera could read the card. Thankfully, demo software I found online was able to recover the photos. That's when I looked online and noticed several complaints against that card in particular and then went to Nikon's site to find tested and approved cards. It'd be great if the vendor threw in a card that was actually approved by Nikon.Overall, the camera is fantastic. It's a much better than the Fujifilm S9000 I was using. I view the kit existing mainly for the extra zoom lens, memory card reader and consumer level tripod. If you get the same bag, you'll want to probably upgrade to a better one. If you get the same SDHC card by Sony, DON'T use it. Google Nikon D5100 memory card and you should see a support page for the camera that lists known good cards.

Reviews.Title: Great!! Absolutely fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Veronika Fabick
Reviews.Content: It's an amazing camera with great body and lens! Not very heavy and takes great photos in the dark as well as in daylight.Great camera for starters... I really enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: An Awesome Tool!
Reviews.Author: Ken Musgrave
Reviews.Content: I finally caved and bought the D5100 (not in the household budget!) to replace my D3000 that just couldn't do the time lapses that I want.  The D5100 is outstanding, but it's put me on the steep end of the learning curve for photography again for the first time since I got my Nikon F2 back in '72.  Much to learn to gain partial mastery of it, but it can do amazing things.  I'm particularly impressed with its low-light performance.  Just last night, not a particularly clear night, I aimed it straight up and did a 30 second exposure of the Milky Way (in a nice dark location) and man, it recorded about a million more stars than I could see with my 57 year old eyes.  This is good, because I intend to do lots of overnight time lapses of the sky and the valley below me.  That's what I bought it for.  It's considerably better than I'd expected.  (Though now I wish I'd sprung for the D5200, which is supposed to be even better.  Anyone wanna slightly used, new D5100 body?)

Reviews.Title: The camera takes a amazing pictures and the bundle is a good value.
Reviews.Author: Donald
Reviews.Content: This is our first DSLR. After looking at many reviews we settled on this one and so far are very pleased. We are glad we got the bundle. Overall it is much better value that buying the stuff separate. I would recommend this bundle to anyone thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Pinette
Reviews.Content: been wanting this for a lone time so glad I finally was able to save up and get this one!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Jorge Santana Corona
Reviews.Content: I Love this camera.You can do so much with it and I would recommend this camera to you camera lovers.Very nice!

Reviews.Title: D5100 and lense bundle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great package.  It arrived as scheduled.  I finally got a chance to use it on a family outing.  Shot over 300 photographs, ended up with almost 10% great photos.  The camera is real easy to use, looking forward to experiencing all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Szepanski
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic deal! I was very hesitant on purchasing this expensive bundle from Amazon.com, however I took a chance, and I'm sure happy that I did. This deal is actually better than the Nikon D5100 bundle that Coscto carried during the holidays. Fortunately, I missed out on their camera package and instead came across this deal. So far, it appears this package includes many more accessories versus Costco's package available during the holidays. Now all I have to do is figure out how to use the camera and all its features! I am currently watching the DVD provided in the bundle and so far it's been very informative, however I will likely need to take a class as I am not a quick learner!

Reviews.Title: Great gift for christmas
Reviews.Author: Hector Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I'm new using SLR Cameras and I think that this camera is fantastic. Easy to use, light weight, ergonomic, wonderful images.. I'm so happy with my investment

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Hoy
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice but have thoroughly enjoyed using the camera/accessories.  I did a lot of reseach at the time of purchase in 2012 and have been very happy with the quality, ease of use with the interface.  I haven't had any concerns or issues.

Reviews.Title: Nice starter camera
Reviews.Author: Grandsplash
Reviews.Content: This was a great starter set for my wife at her entry level photography career.  This set has allowed her to do more than if she would have bought t all over time and at a good fair price.

Reviews.Title: trying to increase shutter speed!!!!
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Shutter speed very slow, HAVE TO USE TRI-POD TO CREAT CLEAR PHOTO.  Tri-pod sent is cheap plastic.  Has difficulty supporting  camera.  Using my own aluminum tri-pod.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: kelsi
Reviews.Content: I love my camera and the price is a way better deal than you will find at any store. You will not regret buying this package. The quality of pictures is so great and all the accessories that it comes with is great to have.

Reviews.Title: my husband loves this
Reviews.Author: All-access Customer
Reviews.Content: we took it out for a test run today on his birthday and snapped 44 pictures- they turned out great.

Reviews.Title: 25th wedding anniversary gift for my husband...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: He loved it.... very nice for a good starter camera that you can add to later if you wish.  My husband likes it just as it is. easy to operate and easy to learn.  He has had hours of fun with it already. I like it because of the quality and the packaged set... took the guess work out.  I look forward to many years of fun photos with  this camera.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a gift.
Reviews.Author: Tom "truth seeker"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my daughter who loves it, with all the attachments that came with it. She highly recommends it.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Dennis Spurgeon
Reviews.Content: this bundle is a great value.i inquired to a couple people who have this equipment and they like it .need to get alot of hands on though.but like anything else more you read and use makes it easy.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur and enjoy this camera. All of the accessories are a major bonus. It allows me to take semi-professional pix.

Reviews.Title: Amaizing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Wifredo M.
Reviews.Content: It is a very complete package, very useful, very cheap and of excellent quality, I recommend it. is an excellent product. The camera works very efficiently, met all my expectations

Reviews.Title: Nice bundle - Excellent sensor in D5100, solid Sigma lens
Reviews.Author: Danny Yu
Reviews.Content: The D5100 was my first DSLR camera, when I purchased a used D5100 body on ebay January 2013. I wasn't willing to buy the D5200 and it's 24 mp sensor, because the difference is only apparent in large prints. In summary, the D5100 has superior image quality and low-noise at high iso (upwards to 1,000 iso) low light situations, a good button layout, and a video mode that leaves the user wanting more.Features at glance:  - 3-inch LCD swivel screen  - 16.2MP (same sensor as D7000)  - In-camera HDR (High Dynamic Range)  - Full HD 1920 x 1080p at 30fps  - ISO Sensitivity: 100-6400 (Extended Mode: 100-25600)PROS+ Stunning image quality - very crisp and sharp+ Easy to navigate through menu+ Good, intuitive button layout. I prefer Nikon's entry level DSLR layout to Canon's, with Nikon's placement of the thumb dial and cursor pad.+ Lightweight+ In camera HDR+ Very good performance at high iso and low light situations+ Reliable and trusty Sigma 70-300mm lens. Not as sharp as Nikon lens, but very very good. Good range and focus rings.CONS+ lack of Nikon branded accessories - no Nikon brand battery grip or LCD cover+ Decent video mode - not fully manual like Canon's entry level Rebel series. The only mode that gives you control is aperture priorityThe D5100 has an excellent sensor in a small form entry level body. If you don't need the extra buttons, LCD screen, weather-sealed body, the D5100 is a great place to start digital photography or as a lightweight backup to pros.Word of caution: as you learn more about digital photography with the D5100, you may find yourself outgrowing the entry level body rather quickly. 6 months later I downgraded the sensor and bought a pro-grade body with the D200. The pro-grade body's rugged build and plethora of buttons are very useful as your skills develop.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: amexico
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas last yearShe has spent a good bit of time reading the manual and says she really likes itI thought the price was reasonable for the items receivedShe uses it to take pictures of birds and would like to have a little longer lens

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Jake's Mom "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: Having fun learning how to use my new camera.  Love all of the options this camera offers as well as all of the accessories that came with the purchase.  I am a beginner to intermediate photographer (depending on what I am photographing) so what this camera offers suits me well.

Reviews.Title: Works just like it should
Reviews.Author: J>J>
Reviews.Content: Still learning the camera and playing around with it, but overall great quality of pictures and lenses are decent for amateur to intermediate photographers.  Great price as well.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: Great, very happy with this item Nikon D5100 16.2MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX -...on time delivery thank you.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera very complete package will meet my needs. Have already taken some great pictures.
Reviews.Author: David M Carvin
Reviews.Content: this is a very complete package and will meet my needs completely. I  Have already taken some great pictures the quality is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: is a very good camera
Reviews.Author: Cano
Reviews.Content: It works very well and I have no problems. It is the best camera I've had.That is why I gave it 5 stars, I recommend it without a doubt.It comes with all the accessories required for a novice photographer to medium.Thanks Nikon

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Christina H.
Reviews.Content: So far I find this camera easy to use.  I still have lots to learn about the manual functions, but the pictures are coming out great!  Focus Camera delivered the product very quickly and well packed to protect it.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great little package
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M Watson
Reviews.Content: great camera, with the price and the starter kit, makes for a real fun time playing. Has everything you need to start of.

Reviews.Title: Tripod is very unsteady
Reviews.Author: Sandy K
Reviews.Content: This would be a full 5 point rating but tripod isn't steady--so I'll need to spend more $$ for that.

Reviews.Title: I Love my new Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: carrie pinkham
Reviews.Content: I waited a very long time to get a digital camera and the Nikon D5100 was worth the wait.. there is lots to learn about what this camera can do and at times I feel a little overwelmed but it takes beautiful pictures

Reviews.Title: Great wedding gift
Reviews.Author: Phillip Brey
Reviews.Content: Wonderful set my mate loved it and have had some great feedback.Great starter kit for anyone starting SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera at an Awesome Price
Reviews.Author: Winterwhispers
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great package deal. Everything you need to start. Even came with labels for your memory cards. I would definitely recommend this set to anyone starting out or looking for a good camera. Another quality Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Kmimi00
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to get his camera in the mail and it was everything it said it was, the picture quality is great and I was VERY happy with this purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Monica Noce
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is easy to use...but I am still learning how to use it and trying to figure out how to make my pictures perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: comicsfan
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift and it arrived exactly as described! It works beautifully! Takes vibrant pictures and is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: d
Reviews.Author: Klaus Braunschaedel
Reviews.Content: The camera and the complete set meets our expections.The camera and the complete set meets our expections.The camera and the complete set meets our expections.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D51oo
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Rusie
Reviews.Content: Thank you for an excellent  porduct at an excellent price.  It took some homework to find a good camera that was affordable, and with the included add-ons in this package, there is nothing that can compare.  Thank you Amazon and Focus Camera LLC for thi opportunity to buy TWO of this package.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: donald Litke
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this camera and all accessories that came with it. I would recommend this produxct to anyone who wants to take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Complete camera deal
Reviews.Author: GRAMFISH
Reviews.Content: The camera and accessories arrived super fast and packaged very well.  This complete outfit is giving a young man much joy.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: robin
Reviews.Content: Great deal, all parts worked except the card reader it deleted all my pictures (good thing they were just a test pictures). Camera works great, as do the lenses

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 DSLR
Reviews.Author: Camera Boy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera. Maybe a little more than I bargained for, I feel it is more for the professional or someone who is really into taking photos other than someone who just takes pictures of family vactions.I'am glad I bought it but I have a lot to learn about it. I have signed up for a photo class.

Reviews.Title: Great quality of image and manual functions
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Beyond the picture quality, the manual functions it has matches the control level I was aiming for! The quality of the lenses are extraordinary and even a professional photographer acquaintance of mine agreed that the ISO level it reaches, the color adjustment and other focus settings are good enough to make pro-level photography.The color balance for the video and the level of sound are very good. Even the night vision and other effect functions are acceptable (while I am still trying all of them, everything works fine). I should point my main purpose is to take stills and not video so I chose this brand for the reviews and recommendations I got for that specific use.Fully recommended purchase.

Reviews.Title: So exited!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kety
Reviews.Content: i've always loved cameras.... i've had many digital cams and always wanted a ptofessional digital camera... they were always really expensive and i never really knew which one i would buy when i had the money....well i saved up and did some research and at last decided to buy the Nikon D5100... i'm still learning how to use it well to get all the advantages it has to offer but its been a month and i'm sooo happy with this camera...i've found it very easy to use... i've gotten a couple of lens and well still learning... every time i grab it i'm like : wow i can do that? and i'm so amazed at the quality!!! lol i'm just overall exited!!!if anyone has any pointers for me or suggestios on how to use it or accessories i should get......PLEASE let me know!!!! i would really appreciate it!!!tks

Reviews.Title: This is the kit
Reviews.Author: FG
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice camera kit for introduction to photography.  Found it!  Just about everything in here in useful and better quality than I was expecting. They originally forgot to ship the bag with the kit so keep your eye out when they send the shipping information showing the items listed.  The SD Card is Sony, the tripod is Bower and has been very useful for indoor use.  Haven't tried it for sporting events but I will soon to see how it holds up outside in the elements.  Also purchased a few filters, macro kit and a Speedlight to wrap up everything I need to get started.  Do the same, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: jsee
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal! The camera is awesome! I have had it for a little less than a year now, and I'm still learning new things about it. The only complaint that I have is the bag that comes with this deal - it sucks! I would recommend getting a better bag but other than that, you can't beat a deal like this! I would also recommend a wireless remote... it comes in handy!

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out for me
Reviews.Author: Crista Zelada
Reviews.Content: I loved the camera and all the accessories, the lens 18-200 that was on the package was awesome!!!! for the month I could used it.... Apparently there was a problem with the software. I received my refund,  and order a new one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Gottahavit
Reviews.Content: This camera is great even for a beginner like me . It came with everything I needed at a reasonable price and takes fabulous pictures. Delivery was right on time and very well packed for protection. I'm very happy with this purchase and the seller.

Reviews.Title: Nikon A+  A+
Reviews.Author: Diana L. Vandergriff
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this purchase. Great buy. I have always bought Canon, but I really like this.Takes seriously great pictures for a amature like myself. Check it out. Start snaping away.This would be for the more mature buyer. 12+ age.Look it up. Let me say the packing was great, and came right on time!!

Reviews.Title: Greaet camera and lens
Reviews.Author: JDCalVino
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner and bought this as an all inclusive package to start documenting my new daughter's early years. The camera is amazing - even I can take amazing pictures easily.  The additional lens it comes with is great.  The rest of the kit is garbage, even for a beginner, there's not quality.  I would highly recommend getting the camera and picking your own accessories out.  I definitely wouldn't trust using the tripod with the camera and the bag is unusable.  I immediately went out and purchased a case logic sling bag (which is awesome!)

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: RJ "Ryan"
Reviews.Content: This is a really great kit that comes with pretty much everything you would need to get started in the photography world.  The lens that comes with it is good, but the stock Nikon lens definitely takes cleaner pictures.The Nikon camera body is also a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Ibrahim Abdulhakeem Olalekan
Reviews.Content: All in all a great buy. Easy to use as a newbie to photography and plenty more to learn as I grow in this new hobbie.No free print papers as stated in the product description.

Reviews.Title: The camera and Lens is Awesome, but just it.
Reviews.Author: Sky
Reviews.Content: The camera and the Lens is Awesome! But the acessory kit is poorly. I'm really happy with then, but I'll buy a new bag, and a new tripod soon, very soon.

Reviews.Title: i hope it's possible
Reviews.Author: rodrigo
Reviews.Content: Hello:I have a question, i want the IR Wireless Remote Control for Nikon D5000/D5100 ML-L3 so i can take a picture without pushing the buton, and have less vibration, but i search a package that could have it, and i didn't find it, so i want to know if you can put this on the kit, instead of the card reader, or the hdmi cable. If you can do this i'll really appreciate.Best regards.Rodrigo Pérez Weil

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 camera
Reviews.Author: Egbert R. Puzon
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5100 camera, has carried its name product, great versatiles camera, it can do a lot of things other camera don't. This camera a little bit expensive but worthy.

ProductInfo.Features:
Nikon D5100 16.2MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-inch Vari-Angle LCD Monitor - Body (Includes manufacturer's supplied accessories)
Nikon 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens - Sigma 70-300mm f/4-5.6 SLD DG Macro Lens with built in motor - Deluxe Lens Care & Cleaning Kit
16 Gigabyte SDHC Secure Digital Memory Card - Secure Digital USB Card Reader - Universal Memory Card Wallet - Pack of LCD Screen Protectors
Additional EN-EL14 Reachargeable Lithium ion Replacement Battery Pack - Well Padded Multi Compartment Gadget Bag with Pockets & Strap -
Full Size 59" Tripod W/Case - Jumpstart Guide to Digital SLR Cameras - BONUS!! Mini HDMI to standard HDMI cable - Free 25 Quality Prints (Promo code # on invoice)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon D5100 16.2MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens and Sigma 70-300mm f/4-5.6 SLD DG Macro Lens with built in motor + 16GB Deluxe Accessory Kit
